meanings.definition: Characterized by rough and noisy behavior.
meanings.sent1: The rowdy children were running and shouting in the park.
meanings.sent2: The party became rowdy as the music got louder.
meanings.sent3: The rowdy puppy knocked over the trash can in excitement.
meanings.sent4: The rowdy storm shook the windows with its powerful winds.
meanings.sent5: The rowdy crowd at the concert made it hard to hear the music.

meanings.definition: A noisy and disorderly person or group.
meanings.sent1: The rowdy at the bar was causing a disturbance with his loud laughter.
meanings.sent2: The rowdy in the classroom was always disrupting the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The rowdy in the movie theater kept talking during the film.
meanings.sent4: The rowdy of geese honked loudly as they flew overhead.
meanings.sent5: The rowdy of fans cheered wildly for their team.
